content.description: Located on the east side of the Left Illness Boulder.  Both routes start off a block in the middle of the wall.  Reach jugs and traverse either left or right and up on huge jugs either way.  Good warmup action.

This route starts on the West side of the Left Illness Boulder.  There are two starts, a stand from obvious jug and sidepull just under the lip, or a sit from an undercling that adds 2 or 3 moves and bumps the difficulty up.  Stand goes at V9/10 and sit is V11.  Once past the stand start hold, fight through some crimps on the face to the slopers at the lip and mantle over.  Very beta-intensive.
content.location: It is on the West side of the Left Illness Boulder.

content.description:
Start as for

Stanley Kubrick

sit, but move straight out the roof making fairly large moves on poor crimps. Exit to the left near the end of the roof.

Here is a video of Carlo making the FA:

vimeo.com/4098627
content.protection: The landing is bumpy, so you'll want a few pads a potentially a spotter.
content.location:
This is far up the gully on the same boulder as

Stanley Kubrick

.

content.description:
Start on the Left Illness Boulder, just below the two V1 warm-ups. Locate two small crimps on the wall below the jugs. Get set on the crimps and toss to the right-leaning, slopey rail above (make sure you tall folk tuck your feet up really hard, or you will dab). Match and get on the jugs. Finish on either of the V1s.

There is a direct finish that doesn't add any difficulty, but makes the ending a little spicier....

Start matched on the same undercling as

Stanley Kubrick

, and make some technical moves up the cave, following

Paths of Glory

. At the incredible jug halfway up the roof, head out right, and pull up onto a slightly techy mantel right in front of the tree.

I am not sure who put this up, or if it has another name and I just can't find it, but it's a solid variation and it deserves a mountain project page. Please educate me in the comments if you know more!
content.location:
It is on the West Illness Boulder following

Paths of Glory

.

content.description:
Start on an obvious jug on the right side of the Right Illness Boulder and using really high feet or campusing, traverse out left using crimps till a pretty big jug.  Then, go straight up for an awkward topout.

Variation: Viral (V3) - Start on same jug, but go straight up instead of traversing out left.

Variation: ??? (V6/7) - After you hit the jug after Bacterial's traverse, keep traversing left to the end of the boulder and top out.
content.location: This is on the Right Illness Boulder.
